[h1]Half-Life 2[/h1]
Ох уж эти вортигонты... Сколько же проблем они мне доставляли на последних уровнях 1й Half-life. Сделать их союзниками людей было верным решением. Помимо того, что теперь не приходится потеть, убивая злобных вортигонтов, мы можем еще и рассматривать их в заскриптованных сценах. Идут, например, какие-то важные переговоры по спасению мира, а мы в это время ходим вокруг озадаченного вортигонта, изучая каждый отросточек его тела.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=724750510
Отличий, от 1й части Half-life, даже помимо очевидных (графика, физика), достаточно много. На этот раз, нам действительно дают разгуляться - здесь тебе и плавание на воздушном катере, по просторам радиоактивных вод, и езда на внедорожнике по шоссе 17, и старые добрые пострелушки, по всем традициям Half-life, и, даже, участие в революции против Альянса - это, разумеется, далеко не все. Каждый уровень, в этой игре, по своему уникален и они, как это было, время от времени, в первом Half-life, не успевают надоедать.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=724384940
Персонажи здесь весьма колоритные. Даже те, кто встречаются нам лишь на одном уровне, успевают занять укромное местечко в нашей памяти, как, например, полусумасшедший священник - Отец Григорий или же Пёс, встречающийся нам лишь в паре глав и не играющий особо важной роли. Стоит убрать одного из них и Half-life 2 будет уже не тот.
На прохождение игры уходит [b]от 10 до 15 часов[/b] - у меня это заняло 13 часов.

[b]Графика, физика, саундрек[/b] - всё смотрится не так уж и плохо даже в 2016.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=725277754
[h1]Вряд ли найдутся те, кто не играли в Half-life 2, но если вы относитесь к той группе людей, кто не испробовал эту игру - советую попробовать.[/h1]

非常棒的游戏！

当年上初中的时候我爸买的CD我当时玩的很High，当年还没有正版，只能買盗版CD玩耍。每天中午放学都顾不上吃饭的玩这款游戏。但是一直有個遗憾就是，我当年玩这款游戏只玩到了黑山基地东区，之后的剧情我都不晓得，因为盗版我玩到那关基本NPC都不动了。

所以说盗版的BUG是真的很坑人啊。这么多年一直以来半条命2黑山过后的剧情我都没有看过，所以说是我的一大遗憾，这回我買了正版弥补了我当年的一大遗憾。也算是完成我当年的一个小愿望。

这两天重温游戏觉得这游戏当年做的真的不错。画面现在来看也不是那么粗糙，剧情关卡细节方面很丰富。而且还能开船開車。估计孤岛惊魂和消逝的光芒信徒的車、操作很多方面都是受半条命影响的。其实没有很晕的。拿到游戏很兴奋，直接这两天百分百通关，全成就解锁。

个人觉得还是有個小小的问题，就是按键Shift+Space一起按有时候会有点不兼容，总不那么灵活。而且跳的时候会跳的很远，很容易就跳到板子外邊。

但是这么小的问题根本不算问题！！大大的一个赞！！一款很棒的经典游戏！！

Nostálgico jogar novamente Half Life 2 depois de tanto tempo do seu lançamento. Para a época, foi um divisor de águas para os games FPS, tanto pela nova mecânica utilizada como pela história envolvente.

O jogo é totalmente em inglês, entretanto, é possível alterar a configuração para menus, comandos e legendas em português, o que facilita a compreensão da história e imersão no jogo.

Infelizmente o jogo disponibilizado na Steam possui um bug na etapa O ANTICIDADÃO, em que os personagens ficam invisíveis e o jogo fecha automaticamente. A forma para solucionar esse bug é criar um novo jogo a partir do início da etapa, Somente assim consegui finalizar o jogo.

Recomendo a todos, e não somente este, mas todos da série Half Life. E torcemos para que os boatos de Half Life 3 se concretizem! :)

I played this game years after it released because I heard it was fantastic.  Well, the reviewers weren't lying.  It's an excellent sequel to the original Half Life.

It's difficult to know where to begin because there are so many great things I could write about this game. I love how it combines gameplay and storytelling in a seamless way.  It has perhaps the most perfect pacing I've ever seen in a game and I became so engrossed with it that I refused to sleep until I had seen the end.  

I love the dystopian atmosphere and the menacing presence of the Combine Citadel and how it literally eats away human civilization.  I love the various enemies you fight and how they are inspired by classic sci-fi monsters such as the Alien Facehugger, the bugs from Starship Troopers, and the Tripods from War of the Worlds.  My favorite part has to be Ravenholm because it managed to disturb me more than most horror games that I've played.  If only the creators of the Dead Space series had studied this level!

The gameplay is also tremendously fun.  Vehicle combat can be hit or miss in some games but in this one they are very easy to use and help your character a great deal. Each level offers an interesting challenge that distiniguishes it from others.  For example, one level teaches you how to use creatures to attack enemies while you run from cover to cover avoiding heavy fire, while another forces you to use objects in the environment as weapons because ammo is scarce.  Usually there is at least one level that's a boring slog in FPS games but I enjoyed all of the ones in Half-Life 2. 

Weapon variety and utility can make or break an FPS, but this game does not disappoint. While I enjoyed all of the weapons, the Gravity Gun is one of my all-time favorites for an FPS, ranking up there with the Wraithverge from Hexen (an awesome-looking cross that shoots four wraiths that can traverse through walls to tear apart your enemies).  
 
Half-Life 2 improves upon the original in every way except for level design.  Older FPS games like the original Half-Life have complex levels that offer multiple paths to explore.  Quake is especially known for its amazing level design, which is why its deathmatch community remained strong for many years.  Half-Life 2 is very linear by comparison, and though that assists with story pacing, it reduces the game's replay value.  Even so, I loved this game so much that I played it twice and still had a blast during my second run.  

If you have never played this game I highly recommend it.  Yes, the graphics are dated compared to today's games, but Half-Life 2 is so well-crafted that you will enjoy it regardless.

[b]Half-Life 2[/b], the game everyone is talking about and wants a sequel for.
Personally, I didn't like the game that much. It sure had it's moments, but if I'd never played it I really don't think I'd care, and I couldn't ever care less if Half-Life 3 ever comes out.
 I guess I should tell you why.

[h1]Why I Didn't Like It[/h1]
The game was alright, but I just found it to be like one of those movies where they nearly get to the end
then something magically happens and all of a sudden they're back right where they started.
I really do believe there was way too much hype around this game, and that's the reason I picked it up. 
It was quite disappointing really. I found the combat super linear, you have lots of guns but you basically just spray at the enemies until they're dead, and to me that's not a lot of fun. The game had some puzzles which were actually the part I enjoyed the most even though I'm not a puzzle game guy. I had to push myself to even finish this game, I really found it boring, the story just didn't interest me at all. This game was not my cup of tea.

[h1]How's It Holding Up?[/h1]
This game runs super well, it's silky smooth, if you can't run this game there is seriously an issue.
Any computer now should be able to run this game without a hitch.
I'm running Windows 10 Pro 64Bit and their was no startup crashes, sound bugs, performance issues, it was perfect.
This game is very well made in that regard.
There are some points in the story where you'll get little teammates along the way, which was alright at first but I found them extremely annoying as they'd get in your way in a small space like a door, staircase, or ally way.

[h1]Final Thoughts[/h1]
Normally I list the pros and cons, but there really isn't any cons, besides my opinion on the gameplay itself.
I suggest watching a video of the first chapter on YouTube so you can get a feel if you'd like it or not.
Also, if you've never played these games before make sure to play the original, it's showing it's age but you're better off getting the remastered one. The story is hard to follow without playing the original.

[h1]7/10[/h1]

I finally played/completed this game for the first time in 2016.  It has aged very well and is still well worth a playthrough even if you didn't play the first one like me (I will be though, then this one again on hardest difficulty).  I very much enjoyed the lack of cutscenes and mindless dialogue.  The ability to explore a little, but still be a linear game is executed well, and the combat is typical Source engine fair, with the addition of some fun ways to kill people without guns.

Let's put it this way: For years and years I never really understand why people were so damn mad about HL3 not existing.  Now I completely understand.

best game

'If you didn't play Half-Life 2, you wouldn't see everything.' /me/

Half-Life 1 maybe meant a beginning of a new era of FPS games. That game was a huge success for reason, but it was quite hard to create a new episode after that. But they did it! Half-Life 2 became the first element of a new era again, an FPS game with a unique world, "a right man on the wrong place", and You are a right one when you are in, but warning! Once you are really in, it is hard to get out.

The game has three parts, the 'original' game, Half-Life: Episode 1 and Episode 2.
In the original game you immediately meet the world of City 17 and it's leader, Wallace Breen. I think that most of you can or will feel the strong atmosphere which could inspire fe. the Bioshock games (even if Rapture with the lead of Andrew Ryan can have a stronger effect for the players).

But I don't want to bore you, so, let me tell a few points at last.
This game is RECOMMENDED for those, who
- like to become a part of a collapsing future world where humans are in a great danger but try to stick together,
- like a dinamic story line with various places, from the city to the zombie world (...)
- like to not just be on foot but 'driving hard and shoot them'
- have good knowledge of english language to understand the in-game conversations
- who played Half-Life 1 and want to know the sequel of it

This game is NOT RECOMMENDED for those, who
- has less patience for in-game dialogs or finding the way on some places
- cannot excuse for some in-game 'mistakes' /maybe bugs/
- who has confidence about some kind of story-line but the game offers something else
- has less skills for FPS games (easy difficulty is still playable I think)

STEAM offers achievements you can earn during the play. This is a very good thing but You think first before You try to get all Lambda signals, complete Ravenholm by using just the gravity gun and complete Sandtraps without touching the Sand. These achievements can reduce the experience of the game.

Have a great time, everyone!
отличная игра))
Gj

Honestly it gets stale, repetitive and just generally boring. The story is basically told through "cutscenes" where you're able to jump around on people's heads in a comical way, but ultimately it's unskippable and makes it tedious on multiple playthroughs. The combat is servicable and set the baseline for source engine games but it stops being fun (though I admit the gravgun in episode 1 is hilarious and doesn't get old) and the level design seems to focus more on the physics puzzles than anything else. You'll probably find yourself aiming up a lot because usually you're in some kind of ditch or pit while the enemies attack from above apache style and it gets old and repetitive.

I have no idea why Half Life seems to get a free pass for all criticism but I sure don't think it should. I recommend it just for one playthrough but don't expect any replayability.

Ах..HALF-LIFE 2...Эта игра поражала всех в 2004-2008 годах,но сейчас немногие её проходят..Так,скоротать время. Но людей,которых её только сейчас получили,становиться больше.

Головоломки здесь такие сложные,что иногда придется читать прохождения и читерить.

Игра стала подспорьем для движка Source и модов.
Порождает целое комьюнити этой игры.

剧情不错，给满分！！！

Decent game in its own right, but has a few issues that bothers me.

Combat lacks punch the first game had. While sound effects do not lack, the bullet sponge nature of enemies makes encounters feel more tedious then they should.

The emphasis on physics-based puzzles gets tedious, and while not difficult, they grow old. Most likely mind-blowing on release, but completely underwhelming in today's age.

The first person cutscenes are still cutscenes, and being unable to skip them will make replaying semi-difficult.

Overall, good game, but not as good as it's typically lauded as.
